p: The anticancer effects promoted by taro extract have been attributed to a lectin named tarin (PDB id. 5T1X and 5T20). This protein is able to reproduce the anticancer and antimetastatic effects of the crude extract when assayed in vitro and in vivo by inhibiting human hepatoma cells (HepG2 lineage) proliferation as well as lung and heart colonization [ 42, 44].
